Class UpdateActivity

  • java.lang.Object

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback, android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompatApi23.RequestPermissionsRequestCodeValidator, android.support.v4.app.TaskStackBuilder.SupportParentable, android.support.v7.app.ActionBarDrawerToggle.DelegateProvider, android.support.v7.app.AppCompatCallback, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnClickListener, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback, RVOnClickListener.OnItemClickListener, java.lang.Runnable, okhttp3.Callback

    public class UpdateActivity
extends android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity
implements RVOnClickListener.OnItemClickListener, android.view.View.OnClickListener, java.lang.Runnable, okhttp3.Callback
    This screen has been designed to update task's status. In this, a RecyclerView has been loaded by the values coming from local database. It is a list of all available status pre-loaded in local database at the time of user login. One more thing to be consider is, user can attach images either by camera or gallery. User can also attach signature with status update.
    Since:
    Version 1.0
    Author:
    mohsin.khan
    Date:
    29 Nov 2016

    • Field Detail

      • layoutAttachments

        private android.widget.LinearLayout layoutAttachments
        This layout simply contains a list of all attachments

      • recyclerView

        private android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView recyclerView
        A flexible view for providing a limited window into a large data set. All the status will be loaded in the following recycler view

      • rvOnClickListener

        private RVOnClickListener rvOnClickListener
        It's an on item click listener for the status recycler view

        android.view.View lastStatusView

      • toolbar

        private android.support.v7.widget.Toolbar toolbar
        Toolbar is a generalization of action bars for use within application layouts. While an action bar is traditionally part of an Activity's opaque window decor controlled by the framework, a Toolbar may be placed at any arbitrary level of nesting within a view hierarchy. An application may choose to designate a Toolbar as the action bar for an Activity using the setSupportActionBar() method.

      • menu

        private android.view.Menu menu
        To change menu configuration on different events

      • appBarLayout

        private android.support.design.widget.AppBarLayout appBarLayout
        AppBarLayout is a vertical LinearLayout which implements many of the features of material designs app bar concept, namely scrolling gestures. Children should provide their desired scrolling behavior through AppBarLayout.LayoutParams.setScrollFlags(int) and the associated layout xml attribute: app:layout_scrollFlags.

        This view depends heavily on being used as a direct child within a CoordinatorLayout. If you use AppBarLayout within a different ViewGroup, most of it's functionality will not work.

        Here we only programmatically expand/collapse this widget that's why it is declared as a global variable.

        private android.app.Dialog dialog
        Progress dialog to block ui while contacting to the server

      • publishResult

        private void publishResult(java.lang.String title,
                           java.lang.String message)
        A method to pop up results in a custom dialog box. It will delete all uploaded files from the disk and finish the current activity if everything is alright otherwise it will just close the dialog box. All data will remain same.
        Parameters:
        title - title text of dialog box
        message - subtitle / descriptive text

      • updateStatus

        private void updateStatus()
        Method to update task status on the server. It is simply calling an api to update task status.

      • toggleAppBar

        private void toggleAppBar(boolean flag)
        To show hide attachments panel
        Parameters:
        flag - true if expand otherwise false
